summary: This appears to be a fragment of text messages or internal communications from August 2019, discussing the need to confirm if Jeffrey Epstein was on suicide watch and instructing someone to 'stick to the script' regarding comments. It references a specific file number (EFTA00087826) and suggests coordination around information control following Epstein's death.

events.title: Communication about Epstein's suicide watch status
events.description: A communication instructs someone to confirm if Jeffrey Epstein was on suicide watch and to 'stick to the script' when commenting.

events.title: Reference to file EFTA00087826
events.description: A follow-up communication states 'Just sent you an EFTA00087826', indicating the sharing of a specific document or file related to the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The communication from August 11, 2019, shows active discussion about confirming Jeffrey Epstein's suicide watch status shortly after his death.
The instruction to 'stick to the script' and the phrase 'Can't comment on that' suggest coordinated messaging or information control regarding Epstein's death.
The document references a specific file identifier, EFTA00087826, which was shared between parties on August 14, 2019.
